metadata.title: Friday, 12th February, 2016
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development and Social Welfare
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to roll out the Social Cash Transfer Programme to Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    whether the beneficiaries have been identified.

questions.minister: Minister of Works and Supply when the construction of Katunda-Lukulu-Mumbezhi road will commence, considering that feasibility studies have already been carried out.
Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a)    whether employees who were retrenched at Zambezi Portland Cement (Zambia) Limited have been paid their terminal benefits; and
(b)    if not, what measures the Government has taken to assist the retrenched employees get their benefits.
(a)    how many road traffic accidents involving cyclists occurred at night country-wide from 2013 to 2015, year by year;
(b)    what the major causes of the accidents were; and
(c)    what measures have been taken to reduce the accidents.
(a)    when the construction of a 1 x 2 classroom block at Washishi Primary School in Lukulu West Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in commencing the works.
(a)    what the total staff establishment of the Zambia Correctional Service is;
(b)    of the number above, how many are university graduates; and
(c)    what measures the Government is taking to attract more university  graduates to join the Service.
(a)    whether teachers at the following schools in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency are entitled to rural hardship allowance:
(i)    Mkangazi; (ii)    Chisale; (iii)    Mtetezi; (iv)    Mwaziputa;
(b)    if so, why they are not paid the allowance; and
(c)    what factors the Government takes into consideration in determining the eligibility to receive the allowance.
(a)    whether there are any national parks that are managed by non-Zambians in the country;
(b)    if so, what the names of the parks are; and
(c)    why the parks are being managed by non-Zambians.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)    when the boundary dispute between Senior Chief Shimumbi of Luwingu District and Chief Matipa of Chilubi District will be resolved; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in resolving the dispute.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Child Development
parts: (a)    when the current National Sports Council of Zambia (NSCZ) Board was appointed;
(b)    how much money the Government disbursed, in grants, to the NSCZ from January, 2013 to October, 2015; and
(c)    how much money was spent on the following, in the same period:

(i)    servicing the Board; and (ii)    support to sports associations. NOTICE OF MOTION Mr Hamududu Report of the Committee on Estimates: That, in terms of Article 203 of the Constitution, this House do adopt the Report of the Committee on Estimates on the Supplementary Provision Warrant No. 1 of 2016.
